properties.location: SH 1 Ngauranga Interchange To Aotea Quay ( Urban Motorway )
properties.description: A New Road Layout Is Now In Place For North & Southbound Motorists While The Ngauranga To Aotea Quay Project Is Underway. The Speed Has Been Lowered To 70km/h In Some Areas. Motorists Are Advised To Expect Minor Delays, Adhere To The Lowered Speed Limit And Take Care At All Times.
properties.locationAreas: SH 1 Ngauranga Interchange To Aotea Quay ( Urban Motorway )

properties.description: The Mt Victoria Tunnel Will Be Typically Closed Between The Hours Of 9pm - 6am, Sunday To Thursday, Until Mid-2016. Plan Your Journey Accordingly Allowing Extra Time For Travel. For More Details Go To Www.nzta.govt.nz/projects/mt-victoria-tunnel
properties.alternativeRoute: Detour Via Newtown. Alternative Route Via Oriental Bay

properties.description: There Are Speed Restrictions In Place While Work Is Carried Out. Road Users Are Advised To Take Extra Care Through This Area.

properties.location: SH 1 North Side Of Brynderwyn Hills

properties.description: Road Users Are Advised That Between The Ohinewai On/off-ramps And Fisher Road Speed Has Been Reduced To 70km In Both Directions. This Speed Restriction Will Be In Place Long-term Due To The Ongoing Works Through The Huntly Section Of The Waikato Expressway Project.

Motorists Should Expect Intermittent Lane Closures And A Lowered Speed Limit While The Mackays To Peka Peka Expressway Project Is Underway. Expect Minor Delays, Adhere To The Lowered Speed Limit And Take Care At All Times.
Sh73 To Be Reduced To A Single Traffic Lane For A Length Of 500m Under The Control Of Traffic Lights.  This Is To Construct A New Retaining Wall As Part Of The Mingha Bluffs Road Realignment Project.
Large Earthworks Site With Majority Of Works Off The Highway. Trucks Crossing. 30km/hr Speed Restrictions With Occasional Stop/go Traffic Management. Expect Minor Delays At Times.

Due To Works On The Sh2/sh58 Haywards Interchange Project, There Will Be Speed Restrictions And Lane Closures At Times. Motorists Are Advised To Expect Minor Delays, Adhere To The Lowered Speed Limit And Take Care At All Times.  For More Details, Go To Http://www.nzta.govt.nz/projects/sh2sh58-haywards-interchange.
New Traffic Signals Have Been Installed And Are Operating. Customers Are Advised That They Are No Longer Able To Turn Right Out Of Manse St Onto Sh1 To Head North.

properties.description: To Enable Works On The Transmission Gully Project, There Will Be A New Road Layout Heading Southbound With A 80km/h Temporary Speed Limit .  Road Users Are Advised To Expect Minor Delays And To Take Extra Care.
Due To Washout Works, There Is A 50km/h Temporary Speed Restriction Near The Manawapou River.  Road Users Are Advised To Take Extra Care.

Due To A Drop Out 500m North Of The Mohaka River Bridge, The Road Is Reduced To One Lane. A Temporary Speed Restriction Of 30km Is In Place, And Road Users Are Advised To Stop On Request As Roadworks Are Being Carried Out.

At The Waihau Road Intersection. These Works Will Be In Place From The 18th May To The 28th Of June For Curve Seal Widening. A 30km/h Speed Restriction Will Be In Place.

Due To Safety Barrier Installation Works Near The Summit Of Mt Cecil, On The Haywards Hill There Will Be Temporary Traffic Management, Such As Lane And Stop/go Closures, As Required. Speed Restrictions Down To 30kph Will Remain In Place Throughout The Works. Expect Delays And Allow Extra Time To Travel Through This Area. These Works Are Dependent On Various Factors Including Weather And May Be Postponed At Short Notice.
Due To Road Works In This Area Expect Delays - Night Works

Minor Improvement Works Will Be Taking Place On Dinsdale Roundabout Between Sunday 29 May And Thursday 30 June 2016. Works Will Include Pedestrian Crossing Signal Installation At Both Massey Street And Whatawhata Road Pedestrian Crossings, Changes To The Traffic Islands Around The Roundabout And Bus Stop Upgrades On Whatawhata Road. Most Work Will Be Carried Out Between Sunday And Thursday Nights Between 7pm And 6am. Delays Can Be Expected While Work Is Being Carried Out.
Retaining Wall And Widening Works. Speed Restrictions And Stop/go.

Shoulder Widening Works On Left Hand Side ( South Bound) Will Be Undertaken From 7th June Till 28th June Weather Dependent. Motorists Are Advised That Speed Restrictions Will Be In Place. Road Users Are Advised To Proceed With Caution.

Safe Crossing Points For Pedestrians Will Be Installed In This Area With Works Being Undertaken From 9th June Till 27th June Weather Dependent, Work Will Be Undertaken Between The Hours Of 7am And 5pm. Road Users Are Advised That Speed Restrictions Will Be In Place And Minor Delays Are Possible.

Safe Crossing Points For Pedestrians Will Be Installed In This Area With Works Being Undertaken From 3rd June Till 20th June Weather Dependent, Work Will Be Undertaken Between The Hours Of 7am And 5pm. Road Users Are Advised That Speed Restrictions Will Be In Place And Minor Delays Are Possible.
